page.title: 01Culrain & Invershin
page.content: Commencing 2 miles NW of Bonar Brodge block lies NE and SW of the Kyle of Sutherland. Valley land intensively farmed, some of which is reconstructed after gravel extraction at Inveren Quarry. The remainder of the block consists mainly of coniferous woodland and moorland. Unlike many surrounding squares it offers employment other than crofting & forestry. In Invershin there is a 24 bedroom hotel open all year round, with restaurant & petroel facilities & an adjoining equesttrian centre. Accross the railway bridge, a "listed building", is Curbisdale Castle, commissioned by the Dowager Duchess of Sutherland, completed in 1914 and gifted to the Scottich Youth Hostels Association in 1945, accommodating upwards of 10,000 visitors a year. Culrain has a primary school currently with 1
